poem:
"Kate Spins the World"

Wool wheel spins on a sun-scored day, 
Kate talks, threads life's loom in her own way.
Garden bricks cradle stories untold, 
Of cats, hens, bees, and a goose bold. 

Her craft woven into the world's quilt,
A homely heart, a global ilk.
Six decades into life's grand dance,
Kate takes her chance, spins her transcendance.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "A new start after 60: I turned my homely lifestyle into a global phenomenon One sunny day in 2017, Kate Jackson, then 61, took a wooden wool-spinning wheel into her garden. She propped her iPad against a brick, pressed record and started talking as she spun – about crafts, the countryside, her menagerie of animals (cats, chickens, bees and Eileen the goose). Jackson enjoyed watching videos about gardening and quilting on YouTube, so one day". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
